caveatsAndRecommendations: Use only for triage assistance with clinician oversight; review top-3 suggestions (not only top-1); monitor drift monthly and revalidate after workflow or data changes

ethicalConsiderations.biasMitigation: Rebalanced sampling, per-group performance monitoring, multilingual augmentation, human review for low-confidence predictions
ethicalConsiderations.limitations: Lower accuracy for rare categories and mixed-symptom narratives; sensitive to short/ambiguous inputs; performance may degrade for languages beyond EN/DA/DE
ethicalConsiderations.misuseCases: Using outputs as definitive diagnosis, denying care based on predicted category, exporting inputs to third-party tools
ethicalConsiderations.privacyConcerns: Potential leakage of sensitive content if raw inputs are logged or exported; re-identification risk from free-text
ethicalConsiderations.privacyPolicy: No storage of raw patient text by default; optional logging requires approval, minimization, and retention limits (e.g., 30 days)
ethicalConsiderations.prohibitedDomains: Medical diagnosis, emergency decision-making without clinician oversight, insurance eligibility decisions
ethicalConsiderations.regulatoryAdherence: GDPR-aligned processing controls; clinical risk management aligned with internal medical device guidance
ethicalConsiderations.regulatoryCompliance: Intended as decision-support only; not certified as a standalone medical device; requires local validation before clinical rollout
ethicalConsiderations.riskFactors: Over-reliance by staff, incorrect routing for rare symptoms, reduced performance on out-of- distribution text
ethicalConsiderations.riskMitigation: Mandatory training for users, usage constraints in UI, escalation to clinician review when confidence is low or symptoms are severe
ethicalConsiderations.riskSeverity: Medium (clinical workflow impact), potentially High if used beyond triage support
ethicalConsiderations.safetyAndSecurityPolicy: Incident reporting workflow, quarterly model monitoring, rollback plan, red-team testing for prompt injection and data exfiltration attempts
ethicalConsiderations.safetyMeasures: Human-in-the-loop requirement; confidence thresholds; “uncertain” output option; prominent disclaimer: not a diagnosis tool
ethicalConsiderations.securityMeasures: TLS in transit, encryption at rest, access control (RBAC), audit logs, rate limiting, secured deployment network
ethicalConsiderations.typeOfBias: Class imbalance (rare conditions), language bias (best performance in Danish/English), demographic phrasing differences (age-related descriptions)
ethicalConsiderations.unintendedUsers: Patients/self-diagnosis use; non-clinical staff making clinical decisions

evaluation.datasets: Held-out hospital triage notes (2024-Q4), synthetic misspelling set, external public symptom QA set (for robustness only)
evaluation.factors: Free-text length (5–300 tokens), spelling noise, multilingual inputs (EN/DA/DE), rare symptom categories, age-group phrasing differences
evaluation.metrics: Macro-F1, Precision/Recall per class, AUROC (one-vs-rest), calibration (ECE), latency (p95)
evaluation.performance: Macro-F1: 0.86 on in-domain test set; AUROC: 0.93 avg; p95 latency: 120ms (GPU) / 680ms (CPU)

factors.hardware: Trained on 4× NVIDIA A100 (80GB); deployed on CPU for batch scoring and 1× NVIDIA T4 for realtime API
factors.software: Python 3.11, PyTorch 2.x, HuggingFace Transformers, FastAPI, Docker

intendedUse.primaryIntendedUseCases: Assisting triage prioritization, routing patients to departments, summarizing common complaint categories for intake workflow
intendedUse.primaryIntendedUsers: Clinicians and triage nurses in outpatient settings
intendedUse.secondaryIntendedDomain: To assist radiologists by providing automated suggestions on the presence of pneumonia in adult chest X-ray images in clinical triage environments.
intendedUse.secondaryIntendedUseCases: Healthcare operations & reportingAggregated trend analysis of complaint categories (non- identifying), operational dashboards, workload planning

modelDetails.description: Predicts likely symptom categories (e.g., respiratory, dermatology, GI) from short patient text inputs for triage support. Produces probability scores and top-3 labels.
modelDetails.license: Internal use license (hospital network only); redistribution prohibited

trainingData.algorithm: Fine-tuning with AdamW; cross-entropy loss; class-weighting for imbalance
trainingData.dataset: ~1.2M de-identified triage notes + complaint labels mapped to 28 symptom categories
trainingData.procedure: Data cleaning + PHI redaction validation, stratified split by facility, early stopping on dev Macro- F1, threshold tuning for top-3 output
